phrases: After our class came back from the trip,
things took a slightly strange turn in our classroom.
I do not have a single piece of chalk.
There were several pieces just this morning...
I am here to prep the classroom.
Is it that scroll you always use?
It will be troublesome if I do not have it.
What is been going on recently?
She looks like she is lost a lot of weight.
I will just have to do without it.
Oh, the bell's about to ring.
Where could that long thing have gone?
It would stand out if it had fallen on the floor.
Teacher, I might know where it is!
Ms. Kawamoto! - I will be right back!
that was taking hold of the class had tried to engulf the teacher.
It was mixed in with the historical timelines in the social studies room.
I am impressed you figured it out.
Oh, I thought they all had the same shape, so...
That is what she says, but Kawamoto is probably the one who hid it.
Would you stop muttering insults about me that are just loud enough for me to hear?
Did you think I was going to hit you?
Of course I would not do that.
Because that would be playing right into your hands.
What do you mean, I hid it?
Teacher, you heard what she said, did not you?
Do you think I am the one who hid it?
Even I can imagine what happened.
I am sure Ms. Takagi and her friends hid it and then blamed Ms. Kawamoto, right?
So how am I supposed to prove it?!
The students change, but every time, there is someone who gets left out and bullied.
And I am just sick of it.
How can you have so much free time to be harassing your classmates?
Tell me, Ms. Takagi, how is it that you have that much free time?
Stop torturing your classmates and study more!
In the first place, who do you think you are?
Involving everyone else in your nonsense...
Think about how you are disrupting the class.
Everyone is studying for entrance exams!
As if a dam had burst, Teacher kept talking.
But her words became less articulate.
After falling silent for a while...
She never returned to school after that.
It was announced that she had been hospitalized due to anxiety.
What is going to happen to our class?
And we have got entrance exams.
And like, whose fault is it?
And so, until your new homeroom teacher is decided, I will be teaching this class from today.
I am Mr. Kokubu, the head teacher.
For you third-years taking high school entrance exams soon,
you understand that how you spend this summer break
will result in a turning point, right?
It is unfortunate for you to have a change in homeroom teachers during this period.
Plus, I heard some of you complaining.
But there was bullying so bad in here that a student transferred to another school,
and yet, out of 38 kids, no one raised their voice except certain people.
So this is the price you are paying for ignoring it.
That being said, before summer vacation, I would like to resolve this to some extent,
so I will be talking to you individually.
The new homeroom teacher's clear, reasonable manner of speaking
When you are called to stay after school, report to the faculty room.
Then, to sort out the situation, each of our parents were called in.
He asked me a lot of questions.
Teacher knew what was going on the whole time.
But she would been a teacher for a long time,
and the same thing kept happening again and again.
And her class would be thrown into chaos every time.
She kept seeing situations she could not do anything about,
until it reached the point where she could not even get involved.
Sis, what should I have done?
It went so far that you have to come in to the school.
Sir, I will take two beef croquettes!
One just as-is, one slathered in sauce!
The depth of the water fluctuates.
You are always warning me about spoiling my dinner.
If you do not get to eat what you like at a time like this, when will you eat it?
Be it a parent-teacher conference, or whatever,
I will always be on your side.
Come on, let us go grocery shopping and then go home.
What do you want for dinner?
Can I have it over my rice?
I will put it on my rice this time too.
I am going to go and give those selfish, rotten parents a piece of my mind!
Tuesday is when you have that important catering job, remember?
It is for an important tea party
to celebrate the 60th anniversary of Shoueidou's founding, our valued customer!
Everyone is looking forward to your sweets, Grandpa!
You know that better than anyone!
This is a big deal for my granddaughter, and I...
I am going to have a good talk with her teacher, so it will be all right.
I promise it will be okay!
I have put you through so much...
Do not worry about Hina and Momo.
I will protect them from the both of us, Mom.
I need to get my sleep.
Okay, Ms. Kawamoto, please come in.
- Ueda was screwing around... - and broke the window with a mop!
Sorry, Kawamoto, can you wait in there with your sister?
These kids are always causing trouble!
I am suddenly in charge of two classes and they do not even let me catch my breath!
Go ahead of me and tell everyone to stay away from the glass!
Well, we will be on our way.
You know, for us, the most important thing this year are the high school entrance exams.
So I think it is better not to make any waves.
Well, going forward, if you would advise your little sister to watch it...
Then for us, I would not have to...
What do you mean by that?
My daughter told me everything I need to know.
It seems your little sister has various issues.
As far as I am concerned...
I do not think my sister has any issues.
In fact, I have no idea what you are talking about.
She spread rumors about my Megumi being a thief!
What does she have against my daughter?!
Do you have honest conversations with your daughter?
Do you properly understand what she is thinking right now?
Your daughter is the one who is been a bully.
I have heard enough false accusations!
This is why I scheduled them at different times!
Fine, then let me ask you this.
The proof that my daughter did it...
Go ahead and show it to me!
Otherwise, I cannot put credence in it.
To begin with, my daughter says she did not do it.
Then I think we are done.
I promise to protect Hina and Momo.
My sister is not feeling great right now, so can we take a break?
You must have been so nervous.
You are as white as a sheet.
I could not respond to her...
After I told Grandpa and Mom that it would be okay, to leave it to me...
A-After I calm down, I-I will go back there once more.
I will sit down and talk to your teacher...
Thank you for being on my side.
That alone makes me really happy!
HINATA KAWAMOTO LOVES GUYS PERVERTED GIRL BITCH IDIOT
No matter what, they would never admit it.
They do not even think they did anything wrong.
And it is just like with Chiho.
When it is over and done with, they will just forget about it.
I do not have a single reason to waste my life on people like that.
I swear I will come to school to the very last day!
But if they do something to me, I will yell at them to stop!
I refuse to keep my mouth shut!
No matter what happens here, if I just survive and graduate, I win!
Honestly, I do not know where this is coming from.
Calling my Megumi a bully is a false accusation of the highest order!
When there is not even any proof.
I mean, of course there is no proof.
The person who does it will never admit it.
The people around the bully know that if they snitch, they will be the next target,
so they keep their mouths shut.
There is no way proof will appear, not with bullying.
It is only natural that there is no proof.
The only person who can say there is been bullying is the victim.
So when Kawamoto said she was bullied, that right there is the proof.
You have to be kidding me!
What if that girl is lying?
Until you show me that, as a representative of the school,
Sis, it will be all right.
I am going to hang in there.
Um, I feel better now, so
Uh, Mr. Kokubu, I was being quite rude earlier...
Miss, you have nothing at all to be sorry about.
Why do not we talk about what to do next?
How long are you going to keep calling me here?
You do not understand how I feel.
So, tell me what is really going on.
Do not miss the next episode of March Comes in Like a Lion.
I will do whatever I can for Hina.
